body:
@sbodenstein Thanks a lot! 
@piiswrong does it have to be on the C++ side? I guess one could also construct the RNN subgraph in Python, and compose with other parts of the computational graph.
U can give some dummy labels and skip their computation,which is easier for you to implement.
@Atry We cannot do this due to the project settings, sorry for the inconvenience. Added as contributor [CONTRIBUTORS.md](https://github.com/dmlc/mxnet/blob/master/CONTRIBUTORS.md)

Hi @wdx04 ,

I have a confuse about it whether or not I unpack the file and put the two .dll into the 3rdparty file of mxnet is Ok?

Hi @wdx04,

Thank you for your help, my mxnet does work now. The error has been fixed. Thank you.
Yes you can do that but python doesn't know whether cudnn is available or not. And the symbol graph will be different with/without cudnn

Hi @pablozhang,
You are welcome. I think placing the two .dll in any directory listed in your PATH environment variable will be OK.

Changes in #2358 is used to handle data and label with different batch size. `n = int(texec.outputs[0].shape[0] / (islice.stop - islice.start))` was a fix to determine how batch size changes.
We would like to know what shape of data and label ctc uses.

Today I update the code, use cmake to generate new solution & project under VS2013,win64
I meet the same problem ,and several weeks ago the build is ok.
Any other thing should I do?

in ctc, labels[0].shape[0] <= outputs[0].shape[0].

for example, in lstm, if use Softmaxoutput, the output shape is  seq_len \* batch_size \* vocab_size, and label shape is batch_size \* seq_len.

if use CTC, the output shape is seq_len \* batch_size \* vocab_size, but the label shape is batch_size \* label_len where label_len <= seq_len.
@antinucleon  I do not know why test is fail, seems my changes are unrelated with tests.
I clone a clean one and re-configure it, then the compilation is ok.
Really appreciate the job by @wdx04 . This can be a temporary fix for the problem.
Also the tests are failing, so this shouldn't have been merged without review.
It's a mistake and I've patched a commit immediately and now the they're fixed.
It will certainly work but sounds like a hack to me. I will try this thanks. Meanwhile, I also hope there will be more elegant solution in the future.
The patch is here: 1a0d91410e095f0226c328c2d6c292043847f56f
test on linux (gcc) already passed

hi,tianqi
 i have tried to do more experiment. There are costs during one epoch in every case as below:

Time cost=164.686  1 machine 1gpu
Time cost=81.730    2 machine 1 gpu
Time cost=121.668  1 machnine 2gpus(gpu0,gpu1)
Time cost=117.28     1 machine  4gpus
And 2 gpu ,the ratio can be 1.35,it seemed also ok. 
And 4gpus,the ratio is the same as 2 gpus.
And 2 machine 1 gpu, the ratio can also be reduced to half.I guess it is becasue every machine load half data,so the time should be reduced.

But why it can't be occured in 4gpus? every gpu has also load its data in fact.
as you pointed copy parameters will take some time.And 2 machines also need to take some time?
Could you give me some more explanation? i am still so confused.
@tqchen
Thanks @qiaohaijun ! It explains why we have the previous error.
The compilation problem should be solved by https://github.com/dmlc/mxnet/pull/2407
The compilation problem should be solved by https://github.com/dmlc/mxnet/pull/2407
Passed CI
Use elementwise product first and then use sum over axis?
use gdb to start python.

@piiswrong @hjk41
The problem persists for CUDA 8.0. Is there a known cause for GPU to fail like this? Is there a known solution?
I does not find elementwise product op, I only find elementwise sum op.
maybe concated them first and do a matrix multiplication with (1,1)?

tqchen,
Thanks for your feedback. How about _LIB.MXKVStorePush call, is it also working asynchronous ? 
When I run on single node with local kvstore, it seems that the execution time of _LIB.MXKVStorePush (inside push method of kvstore.py) is much smaller than the execution time of MXKVStorePush (measured at c_api.cc). Why could this happen ?
I guess that was simply due to inaccurate estimate. The kv store ops are also async

(batch_size \* n_hidden, 1)^T \* (batch_size \* n_hidden, 1) = (1, 1)

But I need (batch_size, 1)...

Another hack way is always set batch_size = 1, this is not good.

Hi Tianqi, 
Thanks for getting back to me. 
I looked at kvstore codes under `src/kvstore` folder. 
the kvstore defined in `kvstore_local.h` is utilized, It seems everything in this file works synchrony. 
I think `MXKVStorePush` at `c_api.cc` is simple an wrapper to the Push method defined in `kvstore_local.h`. They have similar execution time, around 3 seconds for 1 epoch. To my understanding, `_LIB.MXKVStorePush` in python is to call MXKVStorePush in `c_api.cc` directly, as `_LIB` is just a `ctypes` class. But its execution time is much smaller, around 0.8 seconds. I think `_LIB.MXKVStorePush` should have similar execution time to `MXKVStorePush` at `c_api.cc`, despite whether async op or sync ops are used inside `kvstore_local.h` . Am I right ?
you can downlaod in https://github.com/yajiedesign/mxnet/releases. i build windows binary release every day
@xlvector Directly multiply will work. E.g c=a*b. Here \* is elementwise

@sxjscience In http://mxnet.readthedocs.io/en/latest/packages/python/symbol.html, 
I only find broadcast_mul?

I don't think you need to take care of those getData() stuffs. I followed the tutorial and got a functional audio bucketing dataiter. 
The trick is to get the provided_data,provided_label and simple databatch in **iter**() right. Also don't forget the bucket_key. If u are using lstm which has a state, take care of it too.

After u finish implementation, go debug around model.py and execute_manager.py. A default bucket is created with default bucket_key at init. Then on each data batch, a bucket is created if no existed before(The creation takes time, u are expecting low GPU usage at first epoch). 

The most important thing is to update your MxNet before testing. ;) good luck.
It's called something like symbol._mul.
Which tutorial did you follow? I cannot find a tutorial that talks about provide_data, provide_label and databatch.
@tqchen Should I rebase or can you merge?

The one in example/rnn.
Also, check this tutorial [link](http://mxnet.readthedocs.io/en/latest/how_to/bucketing.html).

Moreover, I think it would be useful to list the subclasses functions in the docs.

i.e: If you look at the list on the left In [Python NDArray API](http://mxnet.readthedocs.io/en/latest/packages/python/ndarray.html)s,  you will find `ndarray.NDArray` but neither one of its methods is listed

I have encountered the same problem on Centos. How can I solve this? Thanks
![image](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/8116644/16033274/bc36a416-323d-11e6-873b-978978dcd87f.png)
@vchuravy Could you rebase and I'll merge?

@xlvector thank you for your work!

@piiswrong: yes, it does look straightforward hooking up the cuDNN version. I will try get a first version in the next 2 weeks.

Is there an example somewhere of defining a layer by chaining together C++ ops, or some other example that would help with this? (And am I assuming correctly that this involves chaining ops with derivatives, so that one doesn't have to write a derivative expression explicitly?)
rebased.

@xlvector thanks for your advice~~

Solved using `list_arguments()`:

```
internals = symbol.get_internals()
for i in internals.list_arguments():
    #do stuff
```

works properly
@CharlesMei You need to update the submodules.
@mli @tqchen I've combined some other Mshadow operators to get `reduce_multi_axes` and use it for the binary broadcasting.

You are probably missing some dlls in your PATH environment.
I solved the problem I had by using 
`C:\Program Files (x86)\Microsoft Visual Studio 12.0\VC\bin\dumpbin.exe`
to check which dependent dll is missing.
all functions are async. they just send the operations into the backend engine for execution.

@haria In the data iterator, 
`@property
  def provide_label(self):
        provide_label = self.data_iter.provide_label[0]
        # Different labels should be used here for actual application
        return [('softmax1_label', provide_label[1]), \
                ('softmax2_label', provide_label[1])]`
Can we just use the below, if the data_iter such as NDArray support multiple label input (list of label array). 
 `return self.data_iter.provide_label`
I think this can be done by adding a callback function.

We also have a very large and complicated model, and we see the same error (info.type) != (kNotInitialized). I checked and it happens for a concat node. 
I'm using the latest master branch, but we have been seeing this error since early March. The same code base was working fine for earlier builds. I believe the last Windows release that didn't have this issue was either 0229 or 0321 (I can check if necessary). 
 I checked the commits since then but nothing strikes me as suspicious. But given Alex's findings above, maybe this information can help?
I can not install Baidu-warpctc on windows. So, this cannot run on windows?

I found a workaround for our case which definitely points to concat being the issue. We were using concat to duplicate a symbol N times on axis 1 (which worked fine for earlier builds but now fails). Now I did the same thing with mx.symbol.broadcast_axis(symbol, axis = 1, size = N) and it worked without any issues. 

So, this fails:
list = []
for _ in range(0, N):
        list.append(symbol)
net = mx.symbol.Concat(*list, num_args = N, dim = 1)

while this works:
net = mx.symbol.broadcast_axis(symbol, axis = 1, size = N)
My guess is that the concat op cannot handle correctly the case when the inputs contain duplicates? E.g concat(a, b) will be OK but concat(a, a) will be problematic ?
Very likely - although it used to work fine. We use concat extensively (without duplicates) but only this one seems to have an issue
@sxjscience, in my case no input was the same, but some of them depended in the same nodes.  I think toposort somehow screws up such cases.
@yuzhuqingyun You can submit a issue to https://github.com/baidu-research/warp-ctc
I understand mine is true and this issue can be closed.
@nowozin Any future progress? Random operator in the C++ side will be useful for accelerating RL algorithms.

I think this pull request need more test. It will break example/rnn/lstm_bucket.py.
And it make us must to provide 'data' element in provided_data.

check [bucketing](http://mxnet.readthedocs.io/en/latest/how_to/bucketing.html) example for variant length under example/rnn. I didn't see any difference between your case and images as u didn't mention the time length of each instance.

@sxjscience

when use cpu version,like:
(cmd)>>> z = mx.nd.ones((3,4),mx.gpu(0))
(cmd)>>> z.context

(cmd)>>> z.max(axis = 1)

@sxjscience

@zdltheone Thanks for reporting! I'm checking locally for these operators. `sum_axis`, `max_axis` and `min_axis` are introduced in June. https://github.com/dmlc/mxnet/blob/master/src/operator/broadcast_reduce_op-inl.h#L360-L385 and they are operators written in the C++ side.
@zdltheone The `mxnet.ndarray.max()` has parameter `axis`. Would you help try the latest version? I've tested locally on CPU and there is no problem.
Ok, many thanks to you!
@sxjscience latest one works for me.

I have the same problem and I find if using plt.imshow, we should convert the X into np.uint8 first. Like:
`plt.imshow(X.astype(np.uint8))`

i think i find the root.
The root cause is nothing to do with parameters copy and computaion.This time are only take 10% in my network.The most of time are taken in io read in this funtion for data_batch in train_data:
 The time in 4gpus is the same as 1 gpu .But in face 4gpus ,every gpus load 1/4 data,it should be reduce to 1/4 when io reading.
Could you give some more advice on this?Is it possible to optimize it?
@tqchen
@sxjscience  is there any way to get rid of the RANGE_SWITCH so we can directly make it to some cases like broadcast_mid? This will make the code more general and smaller
The data iterator will automatically pad the data either using data in the beginning, or pad 0, depending on whether it is training or prediction
For graphlab support, please ask in graphlab forum. Thank you.
Yes, it works! thank you very much! @chenjx1005
Everything goes well with the latest version :) @sxjscience
@tqchen, I may have to first get_shape_with a large NDIM like 7 and perform the reducing/broadcasting afterwards. RANGE_SWITCH can be avoid in this way.

previously the reduce_mid and broadcast makes all solve the problem under three dimension array. I guess it is possible to reduce all problem to three dimension array? Collapsing other dimensions before and after the target axis
@tqchen The major problem here is the handling of non contiguous case. E.g, broadcasting (5,1,3,1,2) with (5,4,3,4,2). We need to broadcast over multiple axes that are separated.
I see, so can we do the mid solution for one axis, and the range switch for the non continguous cases? So broadcast on one axis works for any dimensions

@pluskid I just read the Stochastic Depth code. I think attribute could be a good direction. U can drop the computation by passing a gate attribute as possibility to skip it. But I don't know if this attribute can be changed over time.

Yes, this is a good solution. Also, for the non-contiguous case, I can remove the RANGE_SWITCH by get shape with a fixed large NDIM (by padding ones to the shape vector). This seems to be acceptable and will not cause too many additional computation.
sounds good
